layer.name: Skill
layer.definition: Get measurably better at what matters.

questions.text: My systems for managing commitments are ...

answers.4: solid — I rarely drop things because I have reliable methods
answers.5: refined — my systems are tight and I continuously improve them
answers.2: basic — I have some systems but they often fail
answers.3: developing — my systems work sometimes, fail others
answers.1: nonexistent — I rely on memory and drop things constantly

questions.text: My skill in breaking large goals into actionable steps is ...

answers.4: good — I can usually create workable action plans
answers.5: strong — I can turn any vision into executable steps
answers.2: basic — I can break things down but the steps are usually wrong
answers.3: developing — I plan some things well, botch others
answers.1: poor — I dream but can't plan

answers.4: good — I have frameworks that help me decide without paralysis
answers.5: refined — I make good decisions quickly and confidently
answers.2: slow — decisions take much longer than they should
answers.3: inconsistent — I decide well sometimes, poorly others
answers.1: poor — I get paralyzed or decide recklessly

questions.text: My understanding of my own patterns of resistance and avoidance is ...

answers.4: good — I know my weaknesses and can work around them
answers.5: thorough — I've studied myself and know exactly how to handle my resistance
answers.2: vague — I know I resist but don't understand why or how
answers.3: developing — I've identified some patterns, others remain hidden
answers.1: absent — I don't see my patterns

questions.text: My accuracy in estimating how long things will take is ...

answers.4: good — my estimates are usually in the ballpark
answers.5: calibrated — experience has taught me to estimate accurately
answers.2: poor — I consistently underestimate or overestimate
answers.3: improving — I get some estimates right
answers.1: terrible — I'm wrong by factors, not percentages
